pr_title: pypi: publish manylinux wheel as any so works on alpine

timeline.message: pypi: publish manylinux wheel as any so works on alpine

timeline.bodyText: Should we bump this one too?
timeline.author: mschwager
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -46,10 +46,11 @@ def get_tag(self):
         if "macosx" in plat:
             plat = f"macosx_{MIN_OSX_VERSION}_x86_64"
 
-        # The binary we build is statically linked & manylinux compatible, so change platform
-        # accordingly
+        # The binary we build is statically linked & manylinux compatible and alpine compatible
+        # there is no way to specify works with alpine on pypi so set platform as any.
+        # Note that semgrep-core is still incompatible with Windows
         if plat == "linux_x86_64":
-            plat = "manylinux1_x86_64"
+            plat = "any"
         elif plat == "linux_i686":
             plat = "manylinux1_i686"

replies.bodyText: We don't actually build on i686 or publish for it so I'm fine leaving as it
replies.author: brendongo

replies.bodyText: I would remove that elif then. Otherwise it's confusing to see these two conditions together.
replies.author: mschwager
